reference: 101-112. Keynes, John Maynard, The General Theory of Emoloyment, Interest and Money, (1936).
2. The interviews were conducted by Choi as part of his senior thesis at Princeton University, which accounts for the geographic concentration.
3. Real wages are even more flexible. Twelve of the 19 firms had reduced real wages in the recent past by raising money wages less than inflation.

10. Note, however, that our only evidence that the companies paying above-market wages were in fact doing so comes from the companies themselves. We have no way of knowing If they were just trying to rationalize wage cuts.
